Key Match Events: Warriors stifled the Wizards from three-point range, holding them to 23 percent shooting from distance
Warriors controlled the glass on the affair and won the rebounding battle 56-47
Post-Match Reflections: Warriors head coach Steve Kerr may harp on the team's performance, particularly Andrew Wiggins' struggles
Coach Kerr will continue to thrive off of the embarrassment of riches he has on his roster and ride the momentum from this win
Miscellaneous Highlights: Warriors superstar Stephen Curry returned to form, scoring a season-high 24 points on 7-15 shooting from the field
Warriors' defense disrupted Wizards' potent duo, holding Jordan Poole to 2-10 shooting from three-point range
Warriors will pursue their seventh win of the year when they take on the defending champion Boston Celtics on the road on Wednesday night
Others: Warriors' Andrew Wiggins struggled mightily from three-point range, going 0-6
Warriors' Draymond Green, Buddy Hield, and Jonathan Kuminga fulfilled their roles to a tee, contributing to the team's win
